column4: hi people i installed ubuntu 10.10 and when i use apt-get install XXXXXX, my terminal doesnt autocomplete XXXXX with applications by pressing tab. any ideas?
are you using konsole and kubuntu by chance?
no, im using the terminal
is it working in say xterm or a tty?
i have just logged into tty1 and tried it and works just fine (my ubuntu installation is relatively fresh. Installed yesterday)
log in as another user and try terminal then
just did it. works fine in other account
well then delete the config files of terminal and try again
you mean bashrc?
no
i think everything is in ~/.gconf/apps/gnome-terminal
so rm -r  ~/.gconf/apps/gnome-terminal  should do the trick
do i have to logout then login again?
possible. don't know. gconf is quirky
doesn't hurt anyway
hmmm... right now my autocomplete doesn't work at all when using sudo in front of things
so not even in a tty?
im going to logout from gnome and try again, cause in a tty it works...
ok. situation right now: i logged out, logged in again and my autocomplete doesn't work at all with sudo stuff and apt-get doesn't autocomplete programs
don't know an easy way then. delete all the configs and start over again :-)
ok gonna try . thanks anyway ;)
I solved my problem from http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=734023 (just for you to get closure) purge bash_completion, reinstall, add code to .bashrc
never considered that because you said it worked on a tty
because it works, maybe the lines in bashrc changed something?
